required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: uPAR-PET for Prognostication in Patients With Non-small Cell Lung Cancer, Malignant Pleural Mesothelioma and Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Lung

brief_summary.textblock: uPAR PET/CT as a prognostic marker in non-small cell lung cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
Study I: uPAR PET/CT with 68Ga-NOTA-AE105 will be evaluated as a prognostic tool in patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) (stage IV (Ia) operable disease (Ib)) by observer-blinded readings and compared to the prognostic performance of FDG PET/CT and prognostic biomarkers as uPAR.
Furthermore, uPAR PET/CT will be evaluated in a pilot study in patients with malignant pleural mesothelioma (MPM) (Study II) and large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma of the lung (LCNEC) (Study III) and correlated with immunohistochemical uPAR expression.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Study Ia: OS is evaluated after clinical follow-up for 18 months (stage IV disease)
Study Ib: OS is evaluated after clinical follow-up for 60 months (operable disease)

primary_outcome.measure: Study II and III: Uptake of 68Ga-NOTA-AE105 in primary tumor lesion (dichotomized +/-)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Study II and III: Uptake of 68Ga-NOTA-AE105 is evaluated based on PET/CT scans performed within 1 hour post injection of 68Ga-NOTA-AE105

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study Ia: PFS is evaluated after clinical follow-up for 18 months (stage IV disease)
Study Ib: DFS is evaluated after clinical follow-up for 60 months (operable disease)

clinical_study.condition: Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Lung

arm_group.description: One injection of 68Ga-NOTA-AE105 followed by positron emission tomography/computed tomography (PET/CT scan) will be performed before treatment start to evaluate the prognostic value of uPAR PET/CT.

intervention.description: Following injection of 68Ga-NOTA-AE105 the patients will be subjected to PET/CT

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Study I
- Histologically verified NSCLC (Study I)
- Stage IV disease
- Operable disease
- The participants must be capable of understanding and giving full informed written consent
Study II
- Histologically verified MPM (Study II)
- The participants must be capable of understanding and giving full informed written consent
Study III
- Histologically verified LCNEC (Study III)
- The participants must be capable of understanding and giving full informed written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
Study I, II, III
- Pregnancy
- Lactation/breast feeding
- Treatment with neoadjuvant chemotherapy
- Weight above 140 kg
- Allergy to 68Ga-NOTA-AE105

facility.name: Department of Clinical Physiology, Nuclear Medicine and PET, Rigshospitalet

contact_backup.last_name: Andreas Kjaer, Professor, MD, DMSc, PhD
